item.description:
The "Other" Side of Foreclosures

Have you ever wondering about the "other" side of foreclosures?

To create a win-win-win deal, you, the homeowner and the bank need to be happy. We know what we want out of the deal, and we work with the seller to find what they want out of a deal, but what about the bank? What motivates them, and what do they want?

Veteran investor and real estate attorney Barry Greene has not only been responsible for the processing of over thirty thousand residential and commercial real estate transactions since 1983, and owning and managing commercial real estate since 1979, but he has also represented banks when they have to deal with foreclosures.

On March 1st, Barry will be sharing with us some of his tips for working with the bank. Make sure to join us so that the next time you want to work with the bank, you will be in the know!

Pre-Register for Turning the Key and save $5.00!

group.name: Real Estate Networking/Education Meeting in Boston

item.name: ForeclosuresMass' Turning the Key: The "Other" Side of Foreclosures
